tn.text: "Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:02:01|2:3]].
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:04:01|4:3]].

"the mountain of Seir." This refers to the people who lived in Edom because they lived in the Seir mountain range. AT: "the people of Edom" or "the people in the Seir mountains" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"to the mountain" or "to the people of Edom"
The word "Behold" here adds emphasis to what follows. Alternate translation: "Indeed!"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:21:01|21:3]].

tn.ref: I will strike you with my hand
tn.text: AT: "I have stretched out my hand over you." This means "I am about to attack you."
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:33:27|33:28]].
This continues Yahweh's message to the people of Mount Seir.

tn.ref: will know that I am Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:7]].

tn.ref: you poured them out into the hands of the sword
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "you gave them over to their enemies who killed them with swords" or 2) "you killed them with swords" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: at the time of their distress
tn.text: "at the time when they were in a disaster"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:11]].

tn.ref: this is the Lord Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:11]].

tn.ref: I will prepare you for bloodshed
tn.text: "I will prepare you to lose your blood." This refers to being wounded or killed. AT: "I will allow your enemies to brutally kill many of you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Yahweh presents bloodshed as a person who could chase them. AT: "your enemies will continue to slaughter you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: Since you did not hate bloodshed
tn.text: AT: "Since you did hate it when other people were killed brutally."
This continues Yahweh's message to the people of Mount Seir.

tn.ref: when I cut off from it anyone who passes through and returns again
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) I will destroy anyone who enters it or leaves it" (UDB) or 2) "I will make it so that people do not travel back and forth through it."
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:31:17|31:17]].
"desolate forever." This is exaggerated to emphasize the destruction. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: Your cities will not be inhabited
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. It may be an exaggeration for emphasis. AT: "People will not live in your cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
Here "you" is plural. God is speaking to the people of Mount Sier, rather than to a single mountain. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: will know that I am Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:7]].
This continues Yahweh's message to the people of Mount Seir.
The word "You" is refers to the mountain of Seir which represents the nation of Edom.
The word "we" refers to the people of Edom.

tn.ref: even when Yahweh was present with them
tn.text: It is implied that Yahweh was protecting Israel and Judah. AT: "but Yahweh was there protecting Israel and Judah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:11]].

tn.ref: this is the Lord Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:11]].

tn.ref: I will do according to your anger and according to your jealousy
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "I will punish you because of your anger and jealousy" or 2) "I will do things to you with anger like your anger and with jealousy like your jealousy."
This continues Yahweh's message to the people of Mount Seir.

tn.ref: will know that I am Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:7]].

tn.ref: they have been given over to us to devour
tn.text: AT: "the mountains of Israel are for us to devour" or "they are here for us to take control of them" or "we can take whatever we want from them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This continues Yahweh's message to the people of Mount Seir.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:10|3:11]].
The word "you" refers to "the mountain of Seir," which represents the land of Edom. AT: "I will make your land desolate."

tn.ref: I will do the same to you
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) I will make your land desolate" or 2) "I will rejoice when your land is desolate" or 3) "I will make other people rejoice because of your desolation"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:35:01|1:2]].
The word "they" possibly refers to 1) "the people of the earth" or 2) "the people of Israel and Judah."
